name: sellou
ingredients: 2 Tbsp of ground green anise seeds, sifted
1-1/2 Tbsp of ground fennel seeds, sifted
1/2 tsp of fleur de sel (sea salt flakes)
500 g of butter (to make brown butter)
steps: Wash, dry, and toast the sesame seeds. Blanch and fry the almonds (or roast them in the oven). Finely grind the almonds and sesame seeds (some can be coarsely crushed).
Toast the flour in the oven or in a pan until it turns a nice golden color (toasted/roasted flour). Let it cool.
In a large bowl, mix the flour, ground sesame seeds, ground almonds, cinnamon, anise, fennel, gum arabic, and salt.
Melt the butter to make brown butter (remove the white parts/impurities). Add the hot butter and honey to the dry mixture.
Knead thoroughly to incorporate the fat and honey well. The texture should be homogeneous and sandy (or stickier, depending on preference).
Shape into domes or disks and sprinkle with powdered sugar or decorate with whole almonds. Store in an airtight container.
